definition: to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: She would keep the peace if possible;
sentences.chinese: 她要尽可能保持一团和气。

sentences.english: When we speak of unity， we do not mean unprincipled peace.
sentences.chinese: 所谓团结，并非一团和气。

sentences.english: The same measuring apparatus made trades fair so that disputes became less.
sentences.chinese: 量器统一，童叟无欺，纠纷就少，民间一团和气。

friendly/polite/amiable

to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)

a tacit mutual understanding
to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
good-natured

one who tries never to offend anybody
amiable/easy-going
